qas.question: When the rule of law become an agenda item for the General Assembly?
What organization debates the rule of law?
What organization meets to discuss and determine the countries that are considered by the rule of law?
What do the Vienna Declaration and Programme of Action require the rule of law to be used in?
In what year was interest renewed in the rule of law within the General Assembly?
Who consider rule of law and agenda item since before 1992?
Who took renewed interest in the rule of law in 1992?
Who has opposed the rule of law through several debates?
Was argued for lovelorn protection of soldiers during war?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>The General Assembly<b6_0/><b5_0/> has considered rule of law as an agenda item since <a0_0>1992<a0_0/>, with renewed interest since <a4_0>2006<a4_0/> and has adopted resolutions at its last three sessions. <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0>The Security Council<b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/> has held a number of thematic debates on the rule of law, and adopted resolutions emphasizing the importance of these issues in the context of women, peace and security, children in armed conflict, and the protection of civilians in armed conflict. <a2_0>The Peacebuilding Commission<a2_0/> has also regularly addressed rule of law issues with respect to countries on its agenda. The Vienna Declaration and Programme of Action also requires the rule of law be included in <a3_0>human rights education<a3_0/>.
